If your token reaches the edge of the board or collides with another player's token, you are out of the game. The aim of the game is to be the last player left with a token on the board. Strategy therefore consists of trying to drive your opponents either into each other or off the board whilst extending your own route in directions that will make it difficult for your opponents to do the same.

Other notes:

Tsuro was originally patented by McMurchie in 1979 under the name Squiggle Game, but was apparently not published at that time. Somewhat similar to Metro and Spaghetti Junction.
16992.name: Tsuro
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGB Volume 5 - Session Review with Big City, Wyatt Earp, and Tsuro
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 024 – Top 10 iOS Games
Game Gab: Gen Con 2011: Ray Wehrs: Calliope Games
MN 0078 Tile Connection Games - Tsuro, Fresh Fish and More
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 54!!!!
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 56!!!

16993.name: Wisselslag
16993.description:
This game has been developed for a dutch railway maintainer called Prorail.

You have to collect six cities with six different colours. You can try to collect them yourself, try to block your opponents, remove blocks that your opponents have put on you and be extremely lucky to get all different colours.

16994.name: UFO Hunter
16994.description:
Second Edition:

The classic JMG game is now re-made in second edition. Joe Magic Games creates a more in depth search for extra terrestrial life. The 2013 version includes a map board and open trading board, draw bag and bidding clips, 36 action cards, 40 map cards, 40 rumor cards, 48 equipment tokens, 12 map tokens, 55 evidence tokens 18 contact hexes, 6 player cubes, 30 small and 15 large money tokens. It is for 3 to 6 players, ages 12 and older and takes 45 to 60 minutes to play. Players compete to find evidence and start rumors of alien visitors. Some rumors are valid, others are traps set for other players. Players choose from 5 different actions each turn: To travel a short distance by boat or train, a long distance by air, buy equipment, research rumors, or publish findings. The game features simultaneous play, bidding for contacts, and putting your money on rumors either to bluff or share in the evidence found.

From the box:

Join the search to make contact with aliens! Only one player knows if a sighting is real or not. Only you can overcome governments, nature, and even run the risk of being committed to a mental institution and losing it all. Will you travel half way around the world and spend all the money you have to find a weather balloon - or real aliens! It's fast, it's fun and it's easy to learn. Let the hunt begin!

Ages 10 and up

16995.name: La Grande Corsa
16995.description:
A sort of "game of goose" (or "snake and ladders").
It has no board, but a deck of cards (square tiles), shuffled and put face down to form the track at the beginning of the game: the first player landing on each card reveals it and follows the given instructions (e.g. "move one space backward", "nothing happens", "reach the last player", etc.); these effects are valid for the rest of the game.
Each player has a pawn (shaped as a car) starting at one end of the track. The goal of the game is to bring your pawn to the other end of the track.
To play, you simply roll a six-sided die, move your pawn exactly that number of spaces forward and execute the instructions on the card you've reached. After that, it's the turn of the next player.
Thus there's no decision to take in the whole game: simply roll the die and hope.
The track made with cards acts as a "modular board" (it is different in every game).
The game was licensed by the Walt Disney Company and so the cards show some of the famous Disney characters.

16996.name: Oda Nobunaga
16996.description:
This is a Japanese wargame on the famous battles of Oda Nobunaga, one of the most famous personalities in Japanese history.

Published by Bandai.

This package includes 3 tactical games and 1 campaign game.
Okehazama, Anegawa, and Nagashino are the tactical games.
The campaign game has 4 scenarios, such as "Road to Kyoto", "Surrounded Nobunaga", "Doomed battles against Takeda, Uesugi", and "The hero, Nobunaga".

16997.name: Legend of the Galactic Heroes
16997.description:
This is a wargame set in the anime universe of the Legend of the Galactic Heroes.

This game simulates the Japanese most popular space opera novel "The Galactic Heroes Legend", "Ginga Eiyu Densetsu".

In the distant future, Human conflicts between two major powers have divided the Galactic World into "Reich" and "Free Planets".

Reich is under the rule of a dangerous emperor and corrupted aristocrats, while the people of the Free Planets have lost the ideals of their foundation and are under corrupted populism also.

So both camps have no ability to break the enemy or to settle the war which has dragged on for many hundreds of years.

But, the times have produced two geniuses of war into the same period.
One is "Reinhelt von Roengram", the incomparable artist of a war in the Galaxy.

The other is "Yan Wenlee", called "Yan the Miracle", the magician of a war.

Their appearance will change the era that they live in.

In this game, players command Reich or Free Planets.

This game contains three types of space combat ship units (BB,CL,CV) and various units which appeared in the original story.

The game uses a complete original system.

This game combines three types of starships, "Battle Ship", "Galaxy Cruiser", and "Galaxy Fighter".

Players organize Fleets under the command of unique admirals by combining characteristics of Starships.

Each counter in the game is an Admiral in the anime and is rated by his fighting skills.

You use resource points to create or buy ships and put them under your admirals sort of like Hitler's war.

This game came out in Old Games Journal #40.

16998.description:
this is a Japanese tactical Sengoku era battle game.
This is a kind of experimental game.
This is not a historical game in its exact meaning.

16998.name: Takeda Kiba Gundan Cavalry Corps of Takeda Clan

16999.name: Space Race
16999.description:
A multiplayer game of competition to land on the moon.

From the company description:

"The year is 1959 and you have just entered the 'SPACE RACE.'

You are Mission Control in this fast-paced and exciting game of early space exploration. There are 19 different missions to choose from, and you must decide which to try and when in order to stay ahead of your opponenent(s).

But the strategy doesn't end with just exciting space missions. There are satellites, research and investments to consider also. Proper planning here can make the difference.

The game also includes a brief historical synopsis so you can compare your plan with actual U.S. - U.S.S.R. achievements, which makes for an excellent solitaire game.

SPACE RACE is a paper and pencil game of moderate complexity for any number of players. Playing time is approximately two hours. A 10- or 20-sided die is required for play."

The game consists of a 32-page "Micro Game" sized booklet and two player aid charts. Several charts are located in the center of the rules booklet.

Expanded by:

Space Race Expansion Kit

17000.name: The Highest Ground
17000.description:
The Highest ground is a game that imagines a world that has a very long period variable climate. Where an alien species has, approximately every 800 Earth years, collected a band of warriors from the most advanced warrior state on Earth at the time, and transported them to this planet. There they are to achieve dominance over the local population, grow a crop for the aliens and, in the ensuing climactic holocaust, be almost wiped out and, therefore, not become a threat to the aliens.

At the time depicted by the game the [aliens] have just bagged a new group of Earthlings and taken them to the planet. This group is from 1979 and is a bunch of mercenaries on the losing side of an African civil war. They have been grabbed from a soon to be terminally untenable position. They have been taken to a planet where the society that has grown up around the survivors of previous recruiting drives consists of several warring states peopled by Medieval feudal kingdoms and knights, Roman legions, pony riding barbarians and Egyptian pharaohs. The game finds the few mercenaries, having allied themselves with the European kingdoms, at war with the local Roman empire.
